result.execSummary:
The defendant Bryan J Westcott was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take >$500 - $5000), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).
  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program.
Apply 69 days credit.

superMiscConds.notes:
Court costs ($268) and DNA surcharge ($268) are to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision.

  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.
AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit to random urine screens.
No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged and distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (for example, bars, taverns or liquor stores).
No contact with Woodmans in Menomonee Falls or Brookfield Square Mall.
Provide DNA sample if not yet provided.
Case 14CF1035 is dismissed and read in.

supervisions.notes: Court will allow supervision to be transferred to Milwaukee County.
Court costs ($243) are to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision.  DNA surcharge is waived.

Straight Time.

AMENDED 01-05-2015:  Apply 69 days sentence credit.
Concurrent with: Count 3.

Barbara A. Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Bryan J Westcott in court, in custody (Waukesha County Jail), with attorney Nicole M. Masnica.  
Case called along with:  14CF1036

Defendant enters a plea of Guilty to counts 3 & 4.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of both counts 3 & 4.
Repeater enhancer on both counts 3 & 4 are struck.
Counts 1 & 2 are dismissed as read-ins.
Defendant presented statements to the court.


Court orders the following:
Count 3:
Total Prison:  39 Months
Initial Incarceration:  15 Months
Extended Supervision: 2  Years
69 Days Credit

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:  
Court will allow supervision to be transferred to Milwaukee County.
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
No contact with:  Woodmans in Menomonee Falls or Brookfield Square.
DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (i.e bars, taverns, or liquor stores).

Restitution:  $0.00
Costs:  $268
DNA Sample (if not already provided) and Surcharge:  $250
To be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision.

Defendant is eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for Substance Abuse Program.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.



Count 4:
6 Months in the Waukesha County Jail
Concurrent with count 3.

Costs:  $243
DNA Surcharge:  Court Waives.
To be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision.



Defendant to be transferred to Dodge - FORTHWITH.
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 12, 2014 at 11:00 am.

Attorney Nicole M. Masnica in court, defendant Bryan J Westcott not in court, in custody (Waukesha County Jail).

All other conditions remain:

Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing, bound over. Information filed, reading waived.   NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED. Court hears defendant's motion to modify bail. Attorney Masnica presents argument to the court. State objects to any modification of bail and presents argument to the court. Court denies motion to modify bail.   Bail remains as fixed.
